name: How much do you know about World Myth? | Quiz

questions.text: What creature did Gaea create which was so frightening all the gods fled except Zeus?
questions.explanation:
Typhoeus.

	Poor Zeus he too succumbed under Typhoeus. Zeus was imprisoned and spanked -or tortured on occasion by this creature with 100 serpents heads breathing fire. Luckily, Hermes rescued the proud god, and they finally threw Etna on top of the beast.

questions.text: Who was the Greek goddess of crossroads and trivia?
questions.explanation:
Hecate.

	Hecate had to flee from Hera for stealing a pot of rouge for Europa, one of Zeus' lovers. She hid in a house that was contaminated, so she had to go to the underworld and wash the stains off in the River Acheron in order to be cleansed.  She then became the goddess of the underworld. But she is also associated with cross-roads and often seen lurking at the scene of a crime. So the moral of the story - don't pass your cheap blush to your enemies.

questions.text: Who were the male and female principles of the Assyro-Babylonian myth?
Who was the cute cat-headed Egyptian goddess, who was the cynosure of the greatest Egyptian celebrations at 4th century B.C?
What Egyptian god had a big crocodile head? He was believed to have emerged from the dark waters to deposit the cosmic egg (although dubious)?
Who had the boring job of guarding Poseidon's fat herd of seals?
Which Greek kid of Hera took revenge by binding her with an invisible band?
questions.explanation:
Hephaestus.

	Hera deserved it. She threw Hephaestus away and left him to die. But he got even and got the babe Aphrodite.

questions.text: Who was the albino and main Phoenician goddess?
Which Egyptian god invented the hieroglyphics?
questions.explanation:
Thoth.

	ok- Thoth had all the formulas which controlled the forces of nature. I think he was the first G.U.T. theorist.
